# Ticker Project Summary

> **AI Agent Loop Runner** - A Go implementation of the Ralph Wiggum technique for autonomous coding agent orchestration.

## Overview

Ticker wraps the [Ticks](https://github.com/pengelbrecht/ticks) issue tracker and orchestrates AI coding agents (Claude Code, Codex, Gemini CLI) to autonomously complete epics through continuous iteration loops.

---

## Package Comparison

| Package | Purpose | Key Files | Lines of Code |
|---------|---------|-----------|---------------|
| `agent` | AI agent interface & Claude implementation | `agent.go`, `claude.go`, `stream.go` | ~800 |
| `budget` | Cost/token/iteration tracking | `tracker.go`, `pricing.go` | ~200 |
| `checkpoint` | Save/resume state management | `checkpoint.go` | ~150 |
| `engine` | Core Ralph loop orchestration | `engine.go`, `signals.go`, `prompt.go` | ~600 |
| `ticks` | Issue tracker CLI wrapper | `client.go`, `types.go` | ~400 |
| `tui` | Bubble Tea terminal UI | `model.go` | ~900 |

---

## Key Type Definitions

### Agent Interface

```go
type Agent interface {
    Name() string
    Available() bool
    Run(ctx context.Context, prompt string, opts RunOpts) (*Result, error)
}

type Result struct {
    Output    string
    TokensIn  int
    TokensOut int
    Cost      float64
    Duration  time.Duration
    Record    *RunRecord
}
```

### Budget Tracking

```go
type Limits struct {
    MaxIterations int
    MaxTokens     int
    MaxCost       float64
    MaxDuration   time.Duration
}

type Tracker struct {
    limits Limits
    usage  Usage
    mu     sync.RWMutex
}
```

### Engine Signals

```go
type Signal int

const (
    SignalNone Signal = iota
    SignalComplete  // <promise>COMPLETE</promise>
    SignalEject     // <promise>EJECT: reason</promise>
    SignalBlocked   // <promise>BLOCKED: reason</promise>
)
```

### Task & Epic Types

```go
type Task struct {
    ID          string
    Title       string
    Description string
    Status      string   // "open", "closed"
    Priority    int      // 0=critical to 4=backlog
    BlockedBy   []string
    Parent      string   // Epic ID
    Run         *agent.RunRecord
}

type Epic struct {
    ID       string
    Title    string
    Notes    string   // Cross-iteration context
    Children []string // Task IDs
}
```

---

## Features

### Core Capabilities
- **Autonomous task completion** - Agents work through epics without human intervention
- **Multi-agent support** - Pluggable interface for Claude, Codex, Gemini
- **Real-time streaming** - Live output, thinking, and tool activity
- **Budget enforcement** - Limits on iterations, tokens, cost, and duration

### Orchestration
- **Signal protocol** - XML-based signals for completion, eject, and blocked states
- **Checkpoint recovery** - Resume interrupted runs from saved state
- **Epic notes** - Cross-iteration context sharing between agents
- **Task dependency resolution** - Automatic blocker tracking

### User Interface
- **Interactive TUI** - Bubble Tea framework with Catppuccin Mocha theme
- **Pane navigation** - Status, tasks, and output views
- **Markdown rendering** - Rich output formatting with Glamour
- **Pause/resume** - Control execution mid-run

### Integration
- **Ticks CLI wrapper** - Full `tk` command integration
- **Git snapshots** - Commit tracking for rollback
- **Run records** - Audit trail stored with tasks

---

## Signal Protocol

The agent communicates via XML tags in output:

| Signal | Tag | Use Case |
|--------|-----|----------|
| **COMPLETE** | `<promise>COMPLETE</promise>` | All tasks finished |
| **EJECT** | `<promise>EJECT: reason</promise>` | Large install needed |
| **BLOCKED** | `<promise>BLOCKED: reason</promise>` | Missing credentials |

---

---

## Quick Start

```bash
# Build
go build -o ticker ./cmd/ticker

# Run with TUI (interactive)
./ticker

# Run specific epic
./ticker run <epic-id>

# Headless mode
./ticker run <epic-id> --headless

# Auto-select next ready epic
./ticker run --auto
```

---

## TUI Key Bindings

| Key | Action |
|-----|--------|
| `Tab` | Cycle panes |
| `j/k` | Navigate up/down |
| `g/G` | Jump to top/bottom |
| `Enter` | View task output |
| `p` | Pause/resume |
| `?` | Toggle help |
| `q` | Quit |

---
